articles.headline: Highland Park Shooting Reveals Limits of Illinois’s Gun Restrictions
articles.snippet: Legislators and gun control advocates are asking how the 21-year-old suspect was able to buy several weapons despite alarming police encounters and relatively strict state laws.
articles.abstract: Legislators and gun control advocates are asking how the 21-year-old suspect was able to buy several weapons despite alarming police encounters and relatively strict state laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: HIGHLAND PARK, Ill. — On Monday morning, Julie Morrison, an Illinois state senator, was sitting in the back of a convertible, waving to Fourth of July paradegoers, her grandchildren walking alongside the car. Ms. Morrison, a Democrat, had made combating gun violence a priority in her legislative career, and had been the chief sponsor of the state’s “red flag” law, which set up a system in which guns can be taken from someone found to be dangerous.
articles.byline: By Mitch Smith, Campbell Robertson, Frances Robles and Serge F. Kovaleski

articles.headline: Ukraine’s Herculean Task: Helping Millions Whose Homes Are in Ruins or Russia’s Hands
articles.snippet: Millions of Ukrainians have fled their homes as Russia has slowly advanced in the east. Many may not have a home to go back to when the war is over.
articles.abstract: Millions of Ukrainians have fled their homes as Russia has slowly advanced in the east. Many may not have a home to go back to when the war is over.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When she fled her home in eastern Ukraine, Hanna Obuzhevanna, 71, gave her keys to her neighbor to water the blooming cyclamen on her balcony, thinking she’d be back in just a few weeks.
articles.byline: By Emma Bubola and Megan Specia

articles.headline: Comey and McCabe, Who Infuriated Trump, Both Faced Intensive I.R.S. Audits
articles.snippet: The former F.B.I. director and his deputy, both of whom former President Donald J. Trump wanted prosecuted, were selected for a rare audit program that the tax agency says is random.
articles.abstract: The former F.B.I. director and his deputy, both of whom former President Donald J. Trump wanted prosecuted, were selected for a rare audit program that the tax agency says is random.
articles.lead_paragraph: Among tax lawyers, the most invasive type of random audit carried out by the I.R.S. is known, only partly jokingly, as “an autopsy without the benefit of death.”

articles.headline: Fed Moves Toward Another Big Rate Increase as Inflation Lingers
articles.snippet: As the Federal Reserve battles rapid inflation, officials are likely to stay on an aggressive path even as signs of economic cooling emerge.
articles.abstract: As the Federal Reserve battles rapid inflation, officials are likely to stay on an aggressive path even as signs of economic cooling emerge.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve, determined to choke off rapid inflation before it becomes a permanent feature of the American economy, is steering toward another three-quarter-point interest rate increase later this month even as the economy shows early signs of slowing and recession fears mount.

articles.headline: Biden Promised to Stay Above the Fray, but Democrats Want a Fighter
articles.snippet: President Biden’s measured approach at a time of political tumult has left him struggling to inspire his supporters and allies to action.
articles.abstract: President Biden’s measured approach at a time of political tumult has left him struggling to inspire his supporters and allies to action.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Forty-eight hours after a horrific mass shooting on the Fourth of July, President Biden flew to Ohio on Wednesday for a speech on pension plans.

articles.headline: Start-Up Funding Falls the Most It Has Since 2019
articles.snippet: The drop was another fallout of rising inflation and widespread economic uncertainty, and a retreat after years of a funding boom.
articles.abstract: The drop was another fallout of rising inflation and widespread economic uncertainty, and a retreat after years of a funding boom.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For the first time in three years, start-up funding is dropping.

articles.headline: Officials Balked at a Drug Company’s Tax Shelter. Auditors Approved It Anyway.
articles.snippet: Court documents show the potential conflicts of interest when accounting firms simultaneously help clients avoid taxes and audit their finances.
articles.abstract: Court documents show the potential conflicts of interest when accounting firms simultaneously help clients avoid taxes and audit their finances.
articles.lead_paragraph: The drug company Perrigo had a problem.

articles.headline: Siberia or Japan? Expert Google Maps Players Can Tell at a Glimpse.
articles.snippet: In a game called GeoGuessr, competitors try to pinpoint where in the world a Google Street View image has been taken. Some can do it in seconds.
articles.abstract: In a game called GeoGuessr, competitors try to pinpoint where in the world a Google Street View image has been taken. Some can do it in seconds.
articles.lead_paragraph: An unremarkable stretch of highway and trees, as seen on Google Maps’ Street View, appeared on the screen. It could have been anywhere from Tasmania to Texas.

articles.headline: Chinese Police Database Was Left Unsecured Long Before Hackers Seized It
articles.snippet: The breach is “a big black eye” for the Chinese security apparatus, one expert says, exposing the risk of the state’s vast effort to amass citizens’ personal data.
articles.abstract: The breach is “a big black eye” for the Chinese security apparatus, one expert says, exposing the risk of the state’s vast effort to amass citizens’ personal data.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Shanghai police database with a vast trove of personal data that was seized by a hacker or group had been left online, unsecured, for months, security researchers said, in what is probably the largest known breach of Chinese government computer systems.
articles.byline: By Amy Qin, John Liu and Amy Chang Chien

articles.headline: How Wish Built (and Fumbled) a Dollar Store for the Internet
articles.snippet: The number of users has plummeted, and its stock price has dropped. Former employees point to an emphasis on short-term growth over customer service.
articles.abstract: The number of users has plummeted, and its stock price has dropped. Former employees point to an emphasis on short-term growth over customer service.
articles.lead_paragraph: There were unbelievable bargains on “bestdeeal9,” a store hosted on the e-commerce platform Wish, including a $2,700 smart TV being sold for $1 and a gaming computer advertised for $1.30.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Sapna Maheshwari

articles.headline: Jobs Aplenty, but a Shortage of Care Keeps Many Women From Benefiting
articles.snippet: A lack of child care and elder care options has forced some women to limit their hours or sidelined them altogether, hurting their career prospects.
articles.abstract: A lack of child care and elder care options has forced some women to limit their hours or sidelined them altogether, hurting their career prospects.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Lydia DePillis, Jeanna Smialek and Ben Casselman
